ai: Artificial intelligence leverages computers and machines to mimic the problem-solving and decision-making capabilities found in humans and in nature.
blockchain: A decentralized, distributed, and oftentimes public, digital ledger consisting of records called blocks that are used to record transactions across many computers so that any involved block cannot be altered retroactively, without the alteration of all subsequent blocks.
productivity: Productivity includes tips on how to use tools and software, process optimization, useful references, experience, and mindstate optimization.
javascript: Once relegated to the browser as one of the 3 core technologies of the web, JavaScript can now be found almost anywhere you find code. JavaScript developers move fast and push software development forward; they can be as opinionated as the frameworks they use, so let's keep it clean here and make it a place to learn from each other!
career: This tag is for anything relating to careers! Job offers, workplace conflict, interviews, resumes, promotions, etc.
beginners: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." -Chinese Proverb
architecture: The fundamental structures of a software system.
cloud: There is no cloud, only other peoples computers.
tutorial: Tutorial is a general purpose tag. We welcome all types of tutorial - code related or not! It's all about learning, and using tutorials to teach others!
devops: Content centering around the shifting left of responsibility, deconstruction of responsibility silos, and the automation of repetitive work tasks.
bitcoin: Discussions specifically about Bitcoin protocol, economics, and culture.
discuss: Discussion threads targeting the whole community
aws: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a collection of web services for computing, storage, machine learning, security, and moreThere are over 200+ AWS services as of 2023.
opensource: May The Source Be With You!Articles about Open Source and Free Software as a philosophy, and its application to software development and project management.
react: Official tag for Facebook's React JavaScript library for building user interfaces
performance: Tag for content related to software performance.
design: More than just making things look nice...
learning: ‚ÄúI have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.‚Äù - Albert Einstein
database: Posts on building, using, and learning about databases.
community: Building connections, sharing knowledge, and growing together.
node: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.
git: Software for tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development.
css: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a simple language for adding style (e.g., fonts, colors, spacing) to HTML documents. It describes how HTML elements should be displayed.
frontend: "If you're already a front-end developer, well, pretend you're also wearing a pirate hat." - Ethan Marcotte
automation: Automating development, deployment, and operational tasks.
nextjs: Next.js gives you hybrid static and server rendering, TypeScript support, smart bundling, route pre-fetching, and more. No config needed.
testing: Find those bugs before your users do! üêõ
mobile: iOS, Android, and any other types of mobile development... all are welcome!
backend: Server-side development, APIs, databases, and business logic.
privacy: Protecting user data and ensuring digital safety.
algorithms: Heap, Binary Tree, Data Structure it doesn't matter. This tag should be used for anything Algorithm & Data Structure focused.
html: Hypertext Markup Language ‚Äî the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
llm: Large Language Models: the engines behind modern AI.
angular: The framework for building scalable web apps with confidence
cryptocurrency: Digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security.
sql: Posts on tips and tricks, using and learning about SQL for database development and analysis.
postgres: Posts on tips and tricks, using and learning about PostgreSQL for database development and analysis.
ui: Tag dedicated to posts about user interface. Tips, tricks, techniques, approaches, etc.
interview: Tips, tricks, and experiences from technical interviews.
google: Technologies, tools, and news from Google.
portfolio: Getting feedback on and discussing portfolio strategies
pwa: Progressive Web Apps are web apps that use emerging web browser APIs and features along with traditional progressive enhancement strategy to bring a native app-like user experience to cross-platform web applications.
